column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$I started taking bupropion XL 150mg 6 days ago for smoking cessation and anxiety.  I am a 29yo female in good physical health. I read all the reviews about how it effects people with anxiety but I wanted to give it a try. LET ME TELL YOU: I do not recommend this medicine for anyone with legitimate anxiety or panic disorders. I was fine for the first 2 days and then I just started crying about things that normally didn’t make me cry. I chalked it up to hormones being I was approaching a certain time of the month. By day four I was just laying on the couch and had thIs deep feeling of sadness. I tried to push through anyway. Last night
column3: however
column4: I was inconsolable and had the worst anxiety I’ve had in months. I was terrified
column5: sweating
column6: crying
column7: my heart was racing
column8: and I felt like everything was crumbling around me. My thoughts were dark and I couldn’t talk myself down-which I usually can. None of my coping mechanisms worked and all I could do was wait for it to pass. On top of the fact that I never once felt the urge to not smoke! I stopped taking this medication this morning. I know medicine effects everyone differently and this is my first ever experience with an  antidepressant but jeez. I would rather quit smoking cold turkey than deal with this nonsense. It was like I took ten steps back taking this medicine. I’m glad to see and hear that it really helps some people and sometimes it’s worth pushing through and giving it a try. However
column9: if you don’t suffer from depression or even have very mild depression I feel there are probably better options out there. This should not be the first course of action for people with anxiety and honestly
column10: I blame my doctor for totally bypassing the fact that it is not recommended for anxiety sufferers in the first place. I wish everyone good luck and hope this helps so that other people like me don’t have to suffer.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$So far so good. Felt a little weird and sick to the stomach the first week but now after one month I feel more normal with out the constant urge to find something to eat and I started a diet when I started taking it and its the first time in 4 years I've been able to stick to my diet without loosing control and having a carb/sugar fest. Lost almost 8 pounds in a month so I'm sticking to this. It also helps my PTSD by letting my brain rest and not running the same thing through my mind over and over. Stress seems to be lower. Social anxity still there but I'm a introvert by nature so not planning on being the life of the party any time soon either way.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$The drug screwed up my sleep cycle
column3: and so taking it was very difficult. I wanted to give it a fair shake on the ADD
column4: so kept at it. Then I developed odd neurological tingling / twitches in my fingers. Didn't associate it with the drug. THEN
column5: a horrible neurological condition struck
column6: and I was rushed to the hospital. It was hypokalemia -- low potassium -- and it was life-threatening. Bupropion
column7: as it turns out
column8: is associated with this. Ironically
column9: my business partner's boyfriend was a few months later taking it for smoking cessation; she had to drive him to the hospital for the same reason. So just be aware!

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$I was initially prescribed 21 tablets of Bupropion XL 150 mg to take every morning for 3 weeks for depression and nicotine addiction. During the first week I felt much more energetic and somewhat euphoric at times. I also noticed my nicotine cravings begin to dissipate and I began having vivid dreams every time I went to sleep. In week two I had no nicotine cravings at all
column3: but I started having frequent panic attacks and crying spells. By week 3 I was actively suicidal
column4: and my prescriber discontinued my course of treament with this medication. It has only been one day since I stopped taking Bupropion and I feel like my normal depressed self again which I welcome back with open arms as opposed to the extremely emotional and impulsive version. I feel less focused and a little bereaved
column5: but not unbearably so. On a positive note
column6: the thought of smoking a cigarette or vaping nicotine is revolting to me. I hope it stays that way.

column2: I have only ever taken the minimum dose for all of these drugs

45-54 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"This drug saved my life
column3: and probably my marriage. I have experienced no side effects whatsoever. I started on 150mg time release two years ago
column4: and after six months increased to 300mg time release. I take it early every morning once per day
column5: but do not find that it has any effect my ability to sleep. One artifact of taking Bupropion is that I can no longer drink alcoholic beverages without feeling awful
column6: so I have quit drinking completely. This is probably for the best
column7: as before I started using this medication
column8: I drank heavily for 20 years in an attempt to ""self medicate"" my depression. Even though I still love the taste
column9: I have no desire to drink anymore - I'm much happier living without depression than I ever was getting drunk. It seems a small price to pay for the miracle that it has performed in my brain chemistry. I still feel down and sad from time to time
column10: but now it's because I have a reason for it
column11: like people with normal brain chemistry. You're supposed to have mild depressed feelings when bad things happen
column12: and so I've learned to distinguish between these feelings and the depression I lived with most of my life. I have more energy
column13: am more motivated
column14: and can retain my mental focus better than I have in years. I'm more willing to and capable of interacting socially with people
column15: despite being a severe introvert. I'm less of a pessimist and generally more pleasant to be around now than before I began treatment. I wish I'd been prescribed it when I was a teenager
column16: as I believe my life could have been so different. I wouldn't stop taking Bupropion at this point even if they tried to tell me that I didn't need it anymore. I expect to take it for the rest of my life
column17: and I'm fine with that."

That has helped but the only problem now is that the Bupropion has caused me to have heart palpitations all day every day.  I kept waiting thinking they would go away but that didn't work so I just started this morning on Bupropion HCL SR 100mg and still take the 20mg Paxil in the evening.  I really want to stay on the Bupropion to maybe balance out the weight gain caused by Paxil
column3: to have some energy

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I've been on this medication for 4 years. I'm 61. I've been diagnosed with depression bordering on major depression. I've gone thru 4 knee surgeries and now I've had a pacemaker installed. All this happened within the last 18 months. I went from a wheelchair to walking with my cane during that time. I feel my body is breaking down. My exercise routine has been hindered. I can't do the things I could've done before. I have to accept that I'm getting old! All of these factors contributed to taking Bupropion. I have to tell my mental health provider on the next session; that I've increased my dosage. This stems from the latest problems that have transpired. I increased the dosage from 300mg to 400mg. I feel so much better. I see her every 120 days. She knows everything about me. Initially asking many questions ranging from my social life to my sex life. That's to determine what dosage I needed. The only problem; I can't get an erection. Bupropion has the least sexual side effect on that problem. I'll have to live with it. But it really upsets me. I feel that my male ego has been devastated. But life goes on. We review how things are going. She keeps my medical file up to date. We come to an agreement what dosage I need after discussing what's been going on in my life. She's really a great nurse practitioner. Someone to talk and listen to. I enjoy going to see her. I look forward to all of my future sessions with her.

Once I felt normal there was no turning back. Originally given this for postpartum depression when I started noticing all of my other tedious issues subside. 73$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$6/23/2014 10:33:44 AM$Reviewer: Happiermom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Not only do I have Major Depressive Disorder, but my 12 year old son nearly died of a severe brain hemorrhage which caused multiple strokes that paralyzed him.  We literally LIVED at the hospital for 6 months.  I couldn't see straight, through the anxiety and depression.  I thought I would never laugh, smile, sing, dance, or live again.  On Wellbutrin, which I'm taking in 3 sustained release tablets a day (300 mg), I can laugh, smile, sing, dance and live again.  I also take Sertraline (another antidepressant), but it wasn't enough.  Wellbutrin was added after months of Sertraline didn't help completely and made me VERY sleepy.  Wellbutrin helped a little with energy and significantly with mood.  I suppose if I got enough sleep, Wellbutrin could really help with my energy levels, but I'm happy enough being able to get up in the morning and stay awake at work (most days).  Seriously, on Wellbutrin I can laugh again.

75$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$5/27/2014 11:48:36 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$5$I experienced too many side effects with SSRI's so switched to Bupropion. It ended up being the only antidepressant I could take.  It helped with my energy level although I never really felt the same after the major depressive episode which put me on antidepressants in the first place.  It was very easy to come off of, no side effects but I felt a bit of a decrease in energy with an increased feeling of apathy, lack of interest, little enthusiasm.  After a couple of months, I started to gain weight for no apparent reason. I wasn't eating more; after another month or so the weight started increasing at a faster rate. Because of some other symptoms, I believe I need glandular support, mainly thyroid, so am taking supplements and natural remedies. I have begun to lose a little weight and the muscle heaviness I was feeling is subsiding. Of course I'm still seeing my counselor; working on relationships, self-esteem and lots of other stuff. If you're gaining weight after Bupropion and wonder if that is the reason, it very well could be. What's working for me is Iodine,Selenium,L-Tyrosine. I've always been a regular exerciser (running) but that wasn't keeping my weight under control like it always has, and it was becoming more difficult because of the sluggishness I was feeling, then the extra weight to carry around.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$4$"I went to a psychiatrist complaining of an inability to pay attention to tasks for long periods of time and feeling very sorry for myself after some set backs in my career.  The more he asked me questions

column5: I have learned how to deal with them and keep moving forward.  I have forgotten to take my pills for 2-3 days at a time and I have began to feel ""icky"" again.  I am a work in progress and I hope that one day I will be able to live pill free by exercising regularly and eating a clean diet...I am working towards that but for now I am very happy with this medicine.  As for side effects
column6: I am lactose intolerant and have IBS so any nausea or other discomfort have been indistinguishable.  I have occasionally experienced dizziness and slight headaches but other than that

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$"   Paxil was was not working and possibly making things worse. I wanted to get away from the SSRI/SNRI meds so I suggested Wellbutrin to my doctor as an alternative. He had some reservations but started me on the 75mg immediate release Bupropion. One tablet for two days. No problems so the dose was increased to two tablets per day for the next ten days. At this point I was feeling a bit ""wired"" with some muscle twitches and difficulty sleeping. I believe these are typical with this medication. Also had a slight headache. Not real bad but always there. At this point I am wondering if this is the right medication for me. Feeling ""different"" but not really getting the relief that I wanted. I went to three tablets per day for about three weeks. Still having some issues at this point but I was seeing some benefits. Went to four tablets for the next ten days with much improvement.

column1: My most recent prescription was for Bupropion HCL 100mg taken three times a day. After about six weeks into this I feel much improved and confident that this medication will work well for me. Do not discount the effectiveness of this medication too quickly as there are some rough spots to get past before any benefit is seen.

I did use low dose Klonopin to take the ""edge"" off the Bupropion. I did not need more than 1mg per day at the most and I am at a point where I believe I can stop it completely. The sleep issues have been resolved nicely with a 10mg dose of Doxepin at bedtime.
Each individual is different as to the medications that work best. This is working for me.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$1$5$"I was put on bupropion early in 2010 to treat a recently developed severe panic disorder.  My doctor initially put me on 150mg/1x a day
column3: but then raised it to 150mg/2x a day.  Almost immediately
column4: I experienced positive results.  It was working so well for me
column5: that I jokingly called it my ""happy pills"".  Everything seemed to be going quite well
column6: no side effects
column7: no more panic attacks
column8: etc.  Then
column9: on December 13
column11: out of the blue
column12: I had a grand mal seizure.  I had never had a seizure in my life previously.  A month+ later
column13: and major testing having been done
column14: from CT scans
column15: to MRIS
column16: EEGs
column17: EKGs
column18: carotid artery sonogram
column20: stress test EKG and an event monitor...not to mention numerous trips to a cardiologist and neurologist...it was finally determined that the seizure was caused by the bupropion.  Apparently
column21: this drug can lower the seizure threshold in people...and at one point was removed from the market due to the fact that it was being administered at higher levels (than what are currently recommended)
column22: and it was causing a high incidence of seizures in people.  I think far too many people are unaware of that fact.  Don't misunderstand though...if I could take it again
column23: and know I wouldn't have a seizure
column24: I would do so in a heartbeat
column25: it worked that well for me.  Just be aware that it can cause seizure issues...but if you can take it with no side effects

column1: 334$Condition: Stop Smoking$7/8/2008 4:40:49 PM$Reviewer:  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year$5$5$5$I started on this medication 6 months ago to quit smoking. I think the reason why it was so hard for me to stay off smoking was because I was self-medicating my depression symptoms with nicotine. I don't miss it a bit now. The first day I took this medication I had vivid dreams that were somewhat sexual. I have had an increase in sexual desire since starting it but I don't know if it's the medication or the relief of depression that is the cause. I get an occasional headache that lasts for a few seconds and goes away. These are rare about 4 or 5 times a week. It does make my mouth dry and I relieve that by chewing sugarless gum or eating sugarless lifesavers. I have had no change in my weight or eating habits
column2: I am not trying to gain or lose weight. I have had a huge increase in my energy and ability to organize my time. My depression was causing me to be lethargic and disinterested and I did not realize it. Occasionally I have trouble sleeping on this medication but I do not feel tired during the day. I have not had any problem with drinking alcohol while taking it. Overall I give it 5 stars and would recommend it for mild depression.

I took citalopram for 2 years and it really helped but disc after 2 nd trimester when advised by obgyn. I was put back on citalopram (celexa) after nursing my daughter and it really jacked me up. Migraines, excessive sweating, extreme fatigue, No sex drive whatsoever, on edge, vertigo was worse, increased appetite, increased sensitivity to light. However, I slept like a baby as I have been sleep deprived since third trimester in pregnancy. Too uncomfortable, lol. My dr put me on Wellbutrin after I described the side effects. I was hesitant because I did research and its not a drug commonly used to treat anxiety. At first I suffered headaches for a few days following the switch. In the first week I was wanting to get off. I had agitation, I said whatever was in my head (which isn't my style, I'm non confrontational), I felt detached, like I was going through my day with some ease but it wasn't me, i had no real joy. My chest would hurt and my heart would race, nothing new, i have that dealing with GAD in general.I had less patience (which is also unlike me). On the upside, I Loved my new ability to focus and remember things (what a blessing to Moms), and I had energy throughout the day! My sex drive is in full force! I have more joy now, I can live in the moment and it has helped with my anxiety.

My Dr. put me on wellbutrin sr 100 mg twice daily at first and it helped for awhile before I fell back into a rut. column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$4$5$I have suffered from depression since 1994 and had been on a variety of SSRI's and TCA's before being tried on Wellbutrin SR 10 years ago. I found the SSRI's and TCA's all had similar side effects with me
column3: some lightening of the depression but I always seemed to have a crash when I was under stress that resulted in hospital admission for worsening depression and either suicidal thinking or an attempt. Initially my dose was titrated up to 300mg per day but I found I became very agitated and anxious at this dose and my doctor and I slowly decreased the dose to 150mg a day about 9 years ago which is the dose I have maintained. I found that I didn't have any crashes on Wellbutrin SR and I didn't feel depressed anymore. However I am a smoker and I never felt the urge to quit smoking or any reduction in my craving for cigarettes. This feeling of well-being continued until March of this year when a fill-in doctor prescribed 150mg a day of Wellbutrin XL instead of Wellbutrin SR.  Gradually over the last 3 months I have become more depressed and occasionally have suicidal thoughts. This surprised me when I started feeling this way again as there seemed to be no reason for it until I remembered that the doctor had changed my antidepressant from Wellbutrin SR to Wellbutrin XL. The drug manufacturer indicates that doses of the two drugs are equivalent and switching between them at the same dose should not result in any problems. However
column4: in my case
column5: I feel the dose of Wellbutrin XL would have to be increased to give me the same feeling of well-being that 150mg of Wellbutrin SR gave me. I will be switching back to Wellbutrin SR next week and expect that my feelings of depression will be history. As everyone responds to medication differently
column6: there is no reason to believe that anyone else will experience the same effects that I did. However
column7: it is something to consider if you are switched and find the same dose of Wellbutring XL to be not as effective as the Wellbutrin SR.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I have suffered from depression and increasing anxiety for a very long time.  This is my first attempt with medication and I have had great results.  I have been on it for almost three months and I no longer cry everyday!  I am able to deal with my stress and I am able to confront issues that I am upset about instead of running away.  At first I had more panic attacks and had trouble with dizziness but that wore off after three weeks. Be careful driving for the first few weeks-I had problems with the dizziness and focusing about an hour after taking the pill. I also still have problems with my memory-forgetting important numbers and names.  I have noticed that I tend to feel anger and irritability if something is annoying me more so than without the drug.  I have lost 11 lbs so far and hope to continue with the weightloss.  I have had problems with insomnia but rememdy it with 1 Tylenol PM which helps tremendously. I quit smoking two years ago but now more than ever I can't stand the smell of cigarettes-hope I can get more accustomed to that soon.  This drug has improved my life so much-I am a completely new person and I am thankful that I decided to give it a try.

635$Condition: Depression$4/1/2009 10:45:25 AM$Reviewer: stokcarr2, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$If you suffer from depression AND anxiety, I would recommend taking Wellbutrin along WITH an SSRI (Prozac, Lexapro, Paxil, etc.). If you already have anxiety, Wellbutrin alone will make it worse. I took Wellbutrin for 3 years, and then started experiencing severe anxiety, heart palpitations, jitterness, etc. I went off Wellbutrin and started taking Prozac. The Prozac works, but of course then you have the weight gain and the decreased libido. I read here on WebMD that you can take Wellbutrin along with SSRI's, and it will actually increase your libido and will help control your appetite. I tried the two together, and it works! My sex drive came back within two days (yes, two days!), and my appetite has significantly decreased. I think the combination of the two (Wellbutrin and Prozac) brought me to exactly where I need to be!

My family care doc put me on Wellbutrin SR for anxiety/depression. What it did was take my anxiety and make it 1000x worse! Wellbutrin increases dopamine, which if you're depressed is a good thing, but it made my racing thoughs a thosand times worse. I thought I was going crazy. All I could try and do was make it until night-time when I could take my Ambien and get a few hours of sleep. If you're just depressed, it may work great, but use EXTREME caution if you've got anxiety as well as it sent mine spiraling totally out of control.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$5$5$"So doing a quick scan through the reviews of Wellbutrin
column3: I didn't see anyone else using it for the same reason as me.

column1: For the last 2 years I've been battling with a pretty serious methamphetamine addiction. Before I had ever began taking meth (R.O.A. vaporizing in a pipe) I had battled with depression of variable severity
column2: for almost as long as I can remember. I was also diagnosed with ADD as a young kid and was prescribed Adderall as a fix
column3: but only took it for a short period of time (maybe 3 weeks if memory serves me right). The first time I ever used methamphetamine I felt as if I was a normal person for the first time ever. It allowed me to think clearly
column4: express myself more easily
column5: gave me the greatly needed boost of energy and metabolism (have always been slightly overweight)
column6: reduced anxiety and boosted mood. But of course what goes up must come down (especially when you get arrested). So because of added scrutiny from probation and the court system
column7: I became desperate to find something that allowed me to A.)Not crave meth (the mental withdrawals are awful
column8: and you WILL be severely depressed for a long time) and B.) Provide some relief from my baseline issues. *Now please note*

column1: There is not clinical recomend treatment for methamphetamine abuse. But the few independent studies I examined listed Wellbutrin as one of the most effective M.A.T.'s.
I am currently taking 40mg xR orally once daily
column2: and by the 2nd day I instantly noticed a difference in my mental well being. Compared to how bad off I was and just completely unwilling to stop using meth
column3: I would call this a miracle. And ironically the only other methamphetamine user I know that also has taken Wellbutrin reported similar success as myself
column4: I would say it's criminal that they're not doing more research into using this or other similar meds to help curb methamphetamine addiction. "

column1: 720$Condition: Other$12/9/2019 3:06:02 AM$Reviewer: Let’s not meet again
column2: Wellbutrin
column3: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"Wellbutrin (and to be fair
column4: my Drs negligent behavior) almost killed me. I have fairly severe C-PTSD with a lot of disassociation
column5: flashbacks and I am prone to severe bouts of anxiety. I saw my psych when I could tell I was heading towards a depression spiral. I could feel all motivation slipping away
column6: and as a college student with ADHD and finals next week she suggested that I try it. “It’s a super easy drug” she said; “it’ll be fine
column7: what’s the worst that could happen?” I thought.

column1: Literally every side effect it could have caused it did— and I only took it for a week and a bit. I didn’t sleep for days at a time. I saw things I knew weren’t there. I had trouble going to gatherings because I got panicky in crowds (never happened to me before. A friend who isn’t me said it was reminiscent of being stoned). I got super paranoid and anxious
column2: was incredibly confused and couldn’t focus
column3: and I felt like I was going to drop dead from a heart attack. Multiple friends stopped me to ask what I was on and if I needed help getting back to my dorm room because you couldn’t see the color of my eyes. But by far the worst part was that it made me incredibly
column4: indescribably suicidal. I have been suicidal most of my life and had attempted before then but Wellbutrin made it 10000% more horror movie-esque. Instead of thinking about normal (??!?) suicidal thoughts I was so out of it that I was seriously thinking/fantasizing  about super graphic imagery.

column2: during the Welbutrin hell week I still managed to get all As in all my finals.

column1: Additionally an immediate family member tried Wellbutrin with eerily similar results.
****btw I want to make it clear that Wellbutrin works for many people
column2: I think this horrible experience is more on the Dr than anything else. My next psychiatrist said it was “borderline malpractice” to put anyone on a new medication that wasn’t 100p necessary before a stressful time much less someone with my background.***"

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"Firstly note this medicine not for everyone. Everyone's brain chemestry is different. It is one of the most popular and commonly used antidepressant due to it's general efficiency and fewer shitty side effects than other drugs. Personally
column3: two weeks after starting 150mg bupropion
column4: I'm already starting to feel somewhat better overall.

column1: The way I've understood this drug works is by preventing the recapture of dopamine and noradrenaline. This leads to a slow but steady build up of those two chemicals in the brain. That' why the full efficiency of this drug is obtained a few weeks later after starting taking it. Dopamine is the feel good reward chemical which makes you feel slightly happier in general and makes you want to do things more since you're reward signal in the brain is ""boosted"". Not absolutely sur about the noradrenaline part but I think it's from this chemical adrenaline comes from. This could explain why this drug makes you more awake and energized than normally. Not sure but dopamine too i think helps keep awake. Anyways
column2: even the specialists aren't exactly sure HOW antidepressants exactly works.

column1: So far for me the first few days I felt a little ""something"" positively different about how I felt in general. I've been sadly having trouble to feel emotions and happyness for a very long time. Feel like a machine that mainly works eats and sleep. Now I'm starting to have more energy
column2: want to do more things and actually enjoy myself sometimes. Better mood. I actually smile because I feel like it sometimes instead of smiling because I'M supposed to. Don't oversleep anymore. More sociable. Better attention and focus. Think better. Got some libido back. Losing fat and gaining muscle since im more active. Seems I'm actually starting to enjoy life a little. So far the pros are better than cons. Insomnia (i need seroquel to sleep well)
column3: rise in anxiety are the two downsides. A bit worst in the begining but it lessens. Got used to it. Definately worth it for me."

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I had struggled with depression on my own before finally giving in and seeing a therapist. I resisted therapy and drugs for years- men are supposed to take care of their own problems....aren't they? Well a series of very trying and anxiety ridden events pushed me over the edge and on my way to getting help- I'm glad I reached out. After going over the options my doctor prescribed Wellbutrin extended release in a 150mg once daily dose (in the morning- don't take it in the evening or you will struggle to fall sleep). I have to say that this drug has really helped me. The very low
column3: sad moods are gone
column4: the fits of anger have subsided
column5: I have more patience at work and with family
column6: I haven't had a drink in months and I no longer think about suicide. I have a much easier time controlling my appetite
column7: which with giving up alcohol
column8: has resulted in a loss of about 20 lbs. My wife has remarked many times that I am 'nicer' now that I am on medication. I have to take her word for it. Seems I was stuck in a dark pit of my own making and couldn't figure a way to get out. I was going through the motions and was thoroughly miserable while doing it
column9: and making everyone around me uneasy. This drug isn't a cure all for bad attitudes and badly lived lives but it can help
column10: possibly
column11: if a person is motivated to change. It will wind you up a bit- I do take a mild sedative at night to sleep. I have also found Wellbutrin to reduce libido but only slightly - this seems to run counter to many others experience. I have addressed that little problem by taking very small doses (7mg- 1/4 of a 25mg pill) of Viagra when the time is right. Otherwise there seem to be few negative side effects
column12: at least for me. I don't like to take drugs but I recognize that Wellbutrin is very useful. Its off patent and I ask for the generic (Bupropion- inexpensive). At some point I hope to taper down and get off it but I could stay on it for a long time if I needed to and could live my life fully.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$4$My first and worst severe depressive episode had me to believe that I would continue down into the hole I had built for myself. I couldn't see the bright side of a single word

column8: according to the doctor

column1: I share this because while allergies are rare

column3: call your doctor immediately. I know that everyone reacts to medications differently and am hopeful that my experience is unique and that others have a positive experience.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$I was diagnosed with anxiety and depression when I was 14. I tried various medications with little success and many negative side-effects (weight-gain
column3: fatigue

column7: and a drug regimine to control my symptoms. She prescribed a few different medications along the way to try to find one that worked for me
column8: and one of the trials was Wellbutrin. My mother had taken it with good results
column9: so I consented. After about 3 days I was forced to stop taking the pills - my depression and anxiety had gone from distracting but not over-whelming to literally life-threatening in 72 hours. I began self-mutilating (a habit I had managed to break myself of during my pill-less years) and became incredibly paranoid
column10: agitated
column11: angry
column12: depressed
column13: and I isolated myself from everyone and everything. Again
column14: all within 72 hours! I am not saying this medication is horrible and should never be used by anyone
column15: I just want to share my story so everyone knows that yes it can work (like for my mother)
column16: but it might not and might actually be dangerous (like it was for me). So always be sure to discuss any concerns you have with your doctor
column17: beginning or continuing a medication is a big decision and it could have serious effects on your health and your life both positive or negative. Be careful
column18: and good luck!

column1: 1117$Condition: Stop Smoking$1/11/2010 4:40:58 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$1$2$I was taking bupropion to help me quit smoking. I have also been diagnosed with ADHD and Bipolar Disorder so I thought that this might be something to try. well after takeing it for about a week I had a severe allergic reaction. I personally caution all of you that are considering taking this drug for something like quitting smokeing please talk with your doctor about some of the severe side affects to this drug. For me it went well for the first week until i started feeling anxious and a feeling of impending doom. Next came the chest pain and pounding heart. The next day I awoke to find my hands and feet swollen to the point i couldn't wear my gloves or boots. I also had a rash over my entire body and hives. I have stopped taking the medication but 5 days later I am still having trouble breathing a rash and hives. I have been forced to take large doses of several drugs in order to try to combat this reaction to include Epenephrine Benedryl and Prednisone. To let you all know i was the guy that never worried about side affects. I work in the medical field and i was able to monitor my condition and take the right steps in order to treat my condition. If you have any of these side affects don't do like i did go to the ER IMMEDIATELY these are symptoms of what can be a deadly allergic reaction. but pleas don't blow off you doctor when he tells you about side affects listen to them. I will say this though I quit smoking and it works well for that and i felt great most of the time i was on it.

1282$Condition: Depression$2/28/2009 10:35:09 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$3$4$I have been taking Wellbutrin for 13 years.  Overall, it has been effective, but I have had to increase the dosage every few years.  I'm now maxxed on 450/day (and have been for about 2-3 years), and it's no longer working.  My doc and I are in search of something else.  The side effects have been minimal for me.  At first, it affected my sleep and may have caused a bit of weight loss, but that hasn't been the case for several years now.  The two biggest ones that have been consistent since day one have been decrease/loss of sex drive and occasional dry mouth.
1283$Condition: Depression$2/20/2009 1:44:23 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$1$1$dizziness, headach,sleeplessness
1284$Condition: Depression$2/19/2009 4:23:26 PM$Reviewer: carlyjam578, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I've been taking the generic form of Wellbutrin for 2 years now and after a few changes it has done a great job for me. I started out on the XL 300mg once a day but it made my stomach upset and gave me horrible headaches. So I went to my doctor after a few months and we brought it down to 200mg. I take it in the morning and it really does feel like it gives me a burst of energy. I was pretty depressed before and I had issues controlling my anger sometimes, and that is pretty much gone away now. I really like Wellbutrin. I will say though that it makes you twitch sometimes, which I don't like, but it's not noticeable most of the time.
1285$Condition: Depression$2/10/2009 10:59:06 PM$Reviewer: HFoster, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$I was prescribed this med for treatment of post-pardum depression. After a few days of treatment, I started experiencing extreme irritability along with tremors and a severe increase in anxiety. I would rather deal with the depression than these horrible side effects. 
1286$Condition: Depression$2/10/2009 5:55:19 PM$Reviewer: me27513, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$Why do docs use only one drug at a time? After 20 years of experimenting with SSRIs, I have an almost ideal combo of Wellbutrin XL (generic) 150 mg each morning PLUS Lexapro 10 mg each night. Wellbutrin made me hyper at first, so I lowered the dosage. It has no negative sexual side effects, so it balances Lexapro nicely (in fact, it has the opposite effect). No weight gain, late-night munchies, sleeping all the time. It's truly different from all the rest. Effexor was awful, Paxil made me fat, Zoloft made me sleepy, Prozac made me nuts, and none of those helped my depression. Wellbutrin saved me, and its generics are so much cheaper than the alternatives. If you're not doing well with the standard Rx, try this...it's truly different, and ask your doc about combining meds.  
1287$Condition: Other$2/8/2009 11:26:38 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I starting taking this medication to decrease my urge to constantly eating.  I has definately decreased my urge to eat plus provided me with extra energy. I would definitely recommend this.
1288$Condition: Depression$2/5/2009 2:57:05 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$5$i have been using the generic wellbutrin for just a little over a week now.  the first week i took one 150 tablet a day and now i have to increase it to 2 a day.  within a few days i started feeling a little more positive and i noticed that things i would normally get peeved about were not bothering me at all.  i can still feel a little bummed when i think about the things that bother me, but it gets less and less everyday.  The side effects i've had is dry mouth, sore throat, and a weird taste in the morning and late at night.  I have also had insomnia but i suffered from that long before and my doctor has prescribed me a sleeping pill that works hand in hand with wellbutrin.  I have noticed that i have been feeling a little more jittery today since i have increased it but i will moniter and see if my amount is too much.  I believe that this will go away after a while though.  lastly i just wanted to add that i ate my feeling when i was depressed and while i am not horribly overweight i am a little and that was one of my biggest reasons for being depressed.  and slowly i am noticing my appitite and cravings going down and i think i am losing a little weight.  thank god!  but i recommend doing your homework and not settling but finding the right drug for you. before i took lexapro and it killed my sex life and i took cymbalta and it made me very dizzy and nauscious.  so i have finally found something that works FOR ME.

column4: agitation

column6: inability to concentrate
column7: and change in mood(irritable hypo-mania of my bipolar). I am calling my doctor in the morning to discuss these negative side-effects with him

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$4$After dealing with depression for probably two years I finally worked up the nerve to talk to my Dr. about it.  I really didn't want to think I had something I couldn't take care of myself.  I started taking a low dosage of Wellbutrin (actually the generic) once a day about 2 months ago and it has worked very well for me.  The first couple of weeks I felt a little dazed and loopy and I have mild headaches every now and then but those seem to be the only side effects.  I actually lost a little weight when I started but now have come to a stand still in the weight area.  My overall mood has benefited greatly and I find myself enjoying life more and I take things in stride much better. My Dr. has suggested that I only stay on it for a few more months and then go off it which I think I will try as I hate being on a medication every day.  I do think I'll wait until Spring as I live in Upstate New York and our winters always depress me!  I found this sight because I'm looking for a cold medicine with a decongestant that I can take with Wellbutrin.  I don't like having to worry about drug interactions when I just want to take a simple cold tablet.  I would recommend this medicine to anybody that is looking for some releif from depression.

55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$3$3$The Wellbutrin XL was going through my bowell system without being digested.  The pill was showing up in my bowel movements.  The generic is not working that way and is not very effective.

column8: I have no problem sleeping at all.

column1: My biggest word of advise to everyone is to remember that statistically
column2: when people are complaining about something
column3: they tell 10 people
column4: but when they are satisfied with something
column5: they tell one or two.  Don't allow the reviews to deter you from trying this medication
column6: or any other medication that may help you live a normal life.  Try...and try again...until you find the one that works for you.  Wellbutrin is certainly the one that works for me.  I wish you the best of health!"

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been taking Wellbutrin consistently for approximately 8 years now. It was the one and only anti-depressant I was even willing to try based on the possible side-effects. Thankfully
column3: it worked for me because I know many people have to try several different types of meds before they find the right one (or combination) that will work for them. I do recall that it took about six weeks for many of the initial side effects to go away; tingling sensation
column4: bad taste in mouth
column5: mild nausea
column6: insomnia
column7: etc. At the time
column8: I was severely depressed/suicidal and suffered from PTSD as well. The initial bothersome side effects were minor compared to my critical emotional state
column9: so I didn't focus on them too much. I'm glad for that now
column10: because I could've easily decided that the drug wasn't working and found myself getting on the medication roller coaster that many people suffer through. I wouldn't be here if I hadn't taken this drug. The other thing that helped is that I didn't rely on medication alone. At my worst
column11: I was seeing a counselor 2-3 times per week. Eventually
column12: I was able to go on a very light dose (100mg 1xday)
column13: just as a preventative measure. That was 6 years ago. No recurrence of depression and I couldn't identify any side effects that are problematic if I tried. Severe
column14: chronic depression runs in my familly and my first onset of this level of clinical depression was when I was just 9 years old
column15: (I'm 45 now). One of my brothers was even younger. The only family members that are not struggling with severe depression are the ones that are on Wellbutrin. One family member changed meds (from Well to many others) because he couldn't deal with the insomnia and he spent the next 4 years spiraling down to the pits of hell. He went back on it 6 months ago and he's doing well. Yeah
column16: I'm a big fan of Wellbutrin and a fortunate one at that. Good luck to those of you just embarking on recovery. My heart really goes out to you.

1368$Condition: Other$8/13/2008 12:43:13 PM$Reviewer: Future Mrs. Beachem, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$3$Where do i begin? I started this drug a month ago for anxiety and anger issues rolled into a little depression. The first week was heaven! I had more energy than I've had in a long time. As a matter of fact, I couldn't stop talking and was talking really fast as if my brain couldn't keep up with my mouth. I mean it was to the point where my mother thought I had been drinking because I am not usually much of a talker. Then the side effects got worse. I couldn't sleep and went 4 nights straight without sleeping. Benadryl, Tylenol PMC and Sominex didn't help. Finally called my MD and got a prescription for some Lunesta to help me sleep. On top of that, my hands shake like crazy and people are always asking me if I'm nervous, had dry mouth, headaches, slight nausea and the WORST of it is the acne. My face, chest, neck and back are broken out worse than it ever was when I was a teen (I'm 31.) I'm going to continue taking it but me and my doc are going to have a serious talk at my next appointment. If anyone else has had problems with the acne and talking nonstop, please email me at [email protected] and let me know if it gets better or worse.
1369$Condition: Depression$8/8/2008 7:59:34 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$2$After being on Zoloft for about 4 years, I found it was no longer working. So my doctor had me titrate down on the Zoloft from 150mg to 50mg and add Wellbutrin, 150mg twice a day. Starte at just one dose (150mg) in the morning with no bad physical symptoms, although emotionally I was going through hell. Ever since bumping up to the second dose of 150mg, I have constant shortness of breath. Mood is a little better, but not enough to justify this shortness of breath. Also constantly yawning, sleeping poorly (waking up too many times, extremely vivid dreams, waking up too early). Going to talk to my doctor about it. I've read that this drug works better with people who only have depression. Never knew I was overly anxious before Wellbutrin, but beginning to think it is causing me to be so.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$"I started taking Wellbutrin about 2 months ago for depression and it has definately helped me. column5: felt less dizzy and less nauseus as the days went by until eventually I felt normal except for the dry mouth that I have 24/7.

column1: Recently I noticed after 2 months that it seemed to wane just a little and I felt some anxiety again. I asked the pharmacist about increasing my dosage. He put me on 200 mg per day about 3 days ago and WHAM! The nuaseusness hit full force today and I threw up and felt so dizzy that the room continued to spin and I could not function. I have been drinking a lot of water to flush it out of my system and I feel better now. He is now going to let me try 200mg per day in 2 doses 12 hours apart instead of just one big 200 mg dose all at one time.(I weigh less than 120 lbs so it was a bit much for me) Be patient
column2: if you are taking it for less than a month
column3: stay with it for a little longer
column4: the side effects went away for me.

column1: My family members do not know that I am trying this. I noticed that I am much more relaxed and less obsessive about stupid little things and I think more clearly

column1: I hope that it continues to work for me!
I wrote a lot in hopes of helping others.

column1: 1453$Condition: Depression$12/9/2007 8:20:06 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I have struggled with depression my whole life and I am not 34. I have been one-and-off meds since 2000. In April 2007 I went back on the meds again. This time it was Zoloft
column2: which made me feel terrific when it kicked in
column3: but I gradually needed more and more until I (at 110 lbs) was at the maximum dosage of 200mg generic Zoloft (sertraline) by September 2007. So my psychiatrist added Wellbutrin
column4: which seemed to help. Honestly
column5: as someone who actually works as a license adolescent therapist and has a lot of experience with my own and treating depression.... the cycle never ends. You spend your whole life switching meds
column6: gradually going off the meds
column7: changing meds
column8: and starting meds over. The best thing you can do is read a lot of books about depression and figure out what contributes to your depression. For me
column9: I grew up with an alcoholic parents and basically walked on egg shells. You never knew if you'd be yanked out of bed by your hair in the middle of the night to wash dishes
column10: you could never have a friend over and no matter what you did it was wrong. Research shows this actually interferes with your brain development and contributes to depression. Today
column11: I have a busy career and I have to monitor how much I take on or I get angry and obsessive along with the depression. I can also say you need to marry someone who understands depression and is NOT depressed themselves. The spouse needs to be supportive and you need to have rules. One of our rules is that my husband will never walk away from me (because it sends me into a depressive rage). My husband also realizes that sometimes I say mean and nasty things to him that I would never say if I weren't having a depressive angry moment. It's hard. We have a toddler and my husband is an at home dad. We love our daughter and want her to have a parents at home
column12: but it can't be me with my depression. My husband being at home help lessen my depression because it's less home-management for me. [email protected]

1505$Condition: Depression$5/13/2019 11:21:16 PM$Reviewer: thankful, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking 300mg of Bupropion XL (the generic form of Wellbutrin XL) for four years and I have to say this medicine has saved my life. Before I started Bupropion
column2: I had had five depressive episodes in four years; I have not had a depressive episode since I began taking Bupropion four years ago. I can feel happy again and I can laugh. I am able to feel sadness
column3: but it doesn't overwhelm me. I am not drowning in self-loathing anymore. I am myself again and I have been myself for four years. As far as negative side-effects are concerned
column4: I will have a migraine if I accidentally skipped a dose the day before. It also took a while to kick in. The first two weeks were difficult because my brain would go ""offline"" in the afternoon and I wouldn't be able to do anything until my brain ""restarted"" later in the evening. This pattern lasted for a few weeks. The first month was pretty terrible
column5: though there were glimmers that things were changing; I would feel less awful than usual for ten minutes every few days. The second month was a little better; I was able to feel happy for an entire hour one day and could generally enjoy things more. Week nine was when I had five whole good days where I could feel happy any time I wanted all day long. Week ten was when everything took off and I started feeling like myself again. Four years later
column6: this medication still works for me. I have been able to get back on my feet and rebuild my life after my depression because the chemicals in my brain are working for me and not against me. I feel good. I can feel good whenever I want. I'm not held captive by depression anymore. Bupropion made all of that possible."

35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I was suicidal (didn't want to wake up
column3: began to consider suicide
column4: every day was arduous
column5: couldn't eat
column6: socializing was difficult
column7: loss of enjoyment of anything
column8: hopeless
column9: etc).  Went on 150 XL and had slight improvement

column12: my mouth is often dry and now and then my lips get super chapped
column13: and the most notable thing is that i have a slight tremor
column14: particularly in my thumbs.  I cannot easily delicately pick up things
column15: which makes picking at food awkward.  It's about 4 months since i first started taking Wellbutrin (i'm on the generic
column16: btw-Medicaid woo!).  The past week the skin around my thumbs has felt kind of thick when i bend them and TODAY i am noticing a stiffness in my left thumb. None of the other side effects alarmed or excessively bothered me enough to go back to being suicidal
column17: but this stiffness is weird
column18: it's like i don't have full range of motion or my thumb just won't go where i want it to.  Texting tonight has been very awkward
column19: and typing is also feeling kind of weird
column20: so this is the first time i've felt uncomfortable about a side effect.  If it worsens I would start to consider changing it up
column21: but that of course is an upsetting thing to have to deal with and invite that kind of chaos and darkness back into my life now that i'm finally getting on track after wasting months laying in bed.  Hope you guys are doing well.

column2: 19-24 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been been on Wellbutrin for about 7 years now... I started on 150mg & about 3 years ago I was moved to 300mg on the Extended Release. I have taken it with prozac as well as lexapro
column3: but I feel like those medicines make me a zombie. Wellbutrin on the other hand seems to make me procrastinate less. It ""turns the volume down"" on the depressing & suicidal thoughts
column4: gives me energy to do things. It does decrease my appetite
column5: which is good because most of us overeat anyway. I'd say over all this medicine has literally been a life saver."

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was diagnosed with PTSD and Major depressive disorder two hard obstagels to take on in life but I have been taking this antidepressant for more that 10 years and its helped me with the day to day activities whether its at work or helping someone do something
column3: I first started out on Wellbutrin XL 150 once a day
column4: then moved up to 300mg and now I Take a new antidepressant Forfivo XL 450mgs tablet and I Take that once a day usually in the morning and that high of dose helps me more to do the day to day things a work
column5: playing my musical instrument each an everyday.

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I had been on Wellbutrin 150 XL for 3 months as my dopamine all but completely shut off suddenly.I suddenly lost all motivation to do anything and could no longer enjoy any of the things that previously brought me joy.After reading online I believed it was having dopamine and not a serotonin-related issue so I asked my dr to try me on Wellbutrin 150xl's. It took a few weeks but turned the dopamine taps back on near full stream again. Side effects I noticed during this time were weightloss
column3: vivid dreams
column4: poor short-term memory
column5: anxiety(never anxious before)
column6: sudden and vivid recollection of very old memories
column7: intensified fight or flight response and longer to get back down to the baseline as well as oddly stronger smelling urine. I found greatly restricting caffeine mitigated some of the jitteriness. Even with some of these odd side effects
column8: I found it to be completely worth it for me to find enjoyment in my life again. It is also much much easier to cycle off than SSRI's and can be used for cycles when needed. I found it took about 5 weeks for me to feel full effects.

column1: 1524$Condition: Stop Smoking$1/5/2018 8:48:32 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$ive taken this medicine before and quit after taking it for 3 days. This time though it made me a bit shaky
column2: moody from time to time. But i have noticed that everytime i have taken this medicine to quit smoking I honestly quit within 3 to 4 doses of this medicine. it makes the cig taste really nasty and makes me kind of sick to my stomach if i smoke. I dont really have cravings for a cig after the first few weeks. I did notice it does keep me awake at night more than normal. But nothing that is bothersome. so i would recommend this medicine over chantix anytime. Chantix was bad for me. i would sleep walk and literally cook in the middle of the night and not realize it. i would have such horrific nightmares and so much more. i refuse to take that again. so the  only other medicine i can take is this one. and for me it has worked. i set my quit date for jan 1
column3: 2018 and i smoked all the way until 11:30pm the night before. i have been quit ever since without too many issues. but its worth it.

1538$Condition: Depression$4/2/2017 3:22:13 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months$3$2$3$I'm currently taking 450mg. Each increase in dosage was beneficial for about a week, but then I'd hit a plateau. 450 seemed to be the right dose for about 3 weeks, but I've been on this dose for 8 weeks now and feel like the cons are starting to outweigh the pros. I'm not as focused anymore, in fact I've began to have more apathy. My depression hasn't really been helped and I have emotional panic attacks now and then, especially if I drink alcohol-which I was told was the equivalent to completely skipping a dose..makes sense. I've lost 5 lbs, and I'm not binge eating when I feel low, but now I'm obsessed with the weight loss and feel like that's equally problematic. I am less impulsive, but now I seem more obsessive than normal. I've had multiple surgeries in the past 2 years and I was developing a narcotic addiction, within 2 days of taking this medication that craving went completely away, but my ruminating thoughts are increasing again and the impulse to take a pill for no reason but to feel numb is coming back. I take this along with Lamictal, I've been on Lamictal for 3 years, but it wasn't helping with my depression that I cycle with every 6 weeks. I'm ready to get off of this medication, especially since I notice an increase of negative behavior during my menstrual cycle and I'm a week away from another one.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$4$"I have tried 7 other SSRI's and SNRI's altogether. The first day I took 150 mg Bupropion (Wellbutrin) I felt less anxious. The night of the second day

column4: which I had not done in months

column2: while all other side effects have ceased
column3: I am continuing to experience a huge amount of hair loss (alopecia) which is a very rare side effect. There is no other drug like this (that works on dopamine and norepinephrine) and therefore no alternatives to try. For now

column5: even if my hair is thinning. "

From Day 1 your mouth is ALWAYS dry.  Waking up in the morning actually hurts your mouth. On the 8th day I could not get out of bed. My joints and muscles were inflamed and ached so bad I couldn't move. I stopped taking wellbutrin immediately and went back to taking my Effexor. It had been 6 days since I quit smoking (I continued smoking for 2 days in the beginning) so I was much better with the withdrawals. If this medication had not affected my legs and arms, I would probably still be taking it. It worked great for smoking cessation and my libido increased.

1585$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$3/28/2015 7:07:36 PM$Reviewer: b, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin XL worked so well for my severe depression. This medication saved my life and helped me get graduate college. I started feeling better within a week without even trying on 150mg but increased the dose with my doctor to 300mg, which worked the best for me personally. For example, it allowed I was able to stop thinking negatively, could concentrate again, stopped crying all the time, and stabilized my mood at a functional baseline so I could get what I needed out of therapy. All my friends and family told me I was acting more like myself and had my zest for life back. I'm so grateful- before taking it, I did not have enough energy to walk a mile. I had lethargic depression and after taking this medication, I stopped sleeping 14hrs/day, was able to run 3miles like I used to, stopped binge eating, and lost 10lbs after about 5 months on the medication. Once I started getting better (I do not take this medication anymore as my depression resolved after a 9-month combination of Wellbutrin and psychotherapy), I started feeling restless and got agitated, which are side effects and decided with my doctor that I was stable and had enough support in place to stop taking Wellbutrin. I slowly decreased my dose over a month when I did not have a lot of stressful events in my life and consider myself a success story as I rarely have symptoms anymore of MDD. This medication was wonderful and I'm so thankful that it was available when I needed it during the darkest point of my life.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am a 47 year old male diagnosed with ADHD combined with bouts of major depression. Over the years I have tried every tricyclic
column3: SSRI
column4: SNRI and atypical antidepressant on the market. While I was taking Ritalin or Dexedrine I never experienced the dpression but I decided that I wanted to go medication-free for my ADHD. I question the wisdom of that decision but anyhow my doctor suggested we try Wellbutrin and I agreed. I started by taking 150mg first thing in the morning and then 300mg every morning since then. It's been about 5 months now and I can't believe the change in how I feel! Wellbutrin lifted me out of the depression right away (ie within 2 days) and it helps with the ADHD symptoms as well. Not to the same extent as the stimulants but it's enough that I can focus now and get tasks completed. I am so thankful for whoever invented bupropion. One think I noticed is that it is closely related to amphetamine and diethylpropion
column5: both used in the past as anti-depressants/anorectics. I believe it is this similarity that gives Wellbutrin the edge over the SSRI's (which are garbage in my opinion)currently in use and I would not hesitate to recommend Wellbutrin

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was in a car accident & suffered damage in my neck that resulted in neurological damage(complicated migraine in my body). Went to ""top doctors""
column3: acupuncture
column4: chiropractic
column5: etc. the main point is I was told the AMA knows antidepressants have been found to work on specific migraine challenges. For 2 years I tried to get rid of the pain without medication until one day my migraine/stroke symptoms resulted in me thinking I was saying one thing and other words were coming out of my mouth! This terrified me! So I went to a top psychiatrist to see what antidepressant I should take. I had to accept the fact that I could not naturally get rid of my pain! This was in 1995.

column1: After much discussion it was decided that Wellbutrin would be the best medication with the least long term and short term side effects. I took the sample home and decided to work from home for a few days so I could take the medication safely.
I will never forget this experience

column3: 45 minutes after taking the pill
column4: doing paperwork when all of a sudden I felt a tingling sensation in the shape and size of a baseball at the exact location of my neck injury! I knew then that this medication would work. ( please understand that I was told not to expect any improvement for about 2 weeks!) we had to up the med once within in 2 months and that was it! Thru the years I have gone to the next generations

1684$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$1/24/2014 6:08:43 PM$Reviewer: TDT, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$suffered severe anxiety, lost weight, had tremors and had trouble walking in a straight line.
1685$Condition: Depression$1/23/2014 2:52:31 PM$Reviewer: happycamper, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been taking the generic form of Welbutrin (300 mg/day)for the past 3 years for chronic, low-level depression.  It has really helped me be more positive, less anxious, and more focused at work. On rare occasion, when under unusual stress, I take 10 mg of Xanax (in addition to Welbutrin) to help combat my anxiety.  I took Prozac for two years prior to starting on Welbutrin, but it just made me feel emotionally numb and finally stopped working altogether. I have had no adverse side-effects from Welbutrin and have lost the extra weight I gained while on Prozac.  It has not increased my sex-drive (unlike some other reviewers); however, it hasn't diminished it either.  I would highly recommend this drug to anyone suffering from low-level depression; although, I know everyone reacts differently.  My 18-yr-old daughter, who has ADD (inattentive type), was recently diagnosed with depression as well.  She just started taking Wellbutrin this past week (75 mg/day initially, increasing to 150 mg/day next week).  Hopefully, it will help her as much as it has helped me. (She also takes Concerta and Focalin for her ADD).

1687$Condition: Depression$1/20/2014 5:47:27 AM$Reviewer: Frank, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I had tried two other drugs in the past 10 years (SSRI).  I was almost ready to give up but then gave Wellbutrin a try.  The adjustment period was hardly noticeable.  I did have a few nights of restlessness and some night sweats in the first two weeks.  The only major side effect was a major increase in sex drive.  I already had a  high sex drive but this was ridiculous!  Just having thoughts of making love to my spouse brought me to the point of orgasm, while at work!  For a few days, I was going nuts with sexual desire.  Eventually, this side effect ended by the start of week three.  Now, after two months, I'm feeling much more calm and in control of my emotions.  Thoughts of suicide continued in the first few weeks.  Now, after a couple of months, those feelings are gone too.  I also no longer have any desire to smoke and other habitual desires are also gone.  My stuttering, and fast speech and anxiety are also more in control.  Overall, this is my miracle drug.  Can't say it will be the same for you, but for me, life is now grand and improving.

column1:
1690$Condition: Depression$1/16/2014 12:08:01 PM$Reviewer: Katherine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I initially started Wellbutrin at 300 mg/day (150 mg twice per day) in 2005 along with Celexa at 20 mg due to depression and anxiety. I eventually stopped taking Wellbutrin when my Celexa dose was increased to 60 mg which appeared to be the right dose/medication for me. I was recently reduced to 40 mg of Celexa due to new studies that no more than 40 mg should be taken due to risk of heart issues/death. I am now back on Wellbutrin at 300 mg/day due to the decreased dosage of Celexa. Wellbutrin has worked for me. Side effects included decreased appetite, a little weight loss initially and dry mouth. I am a smoker and I thought Wellbutrin might help with that too, however, I did not notice any decrease in cigarette cravings while on Wellbutrin. The only thing I STRONGLY caution is do not EVER take more than your prescribed amount of Wellbutrin. I overdosed by accident (took 600 mg in one day) about 2 years after I started taking it, it was the worst experience of my life. Hallucinations, paranoia, insomnia....I literally thought I was dead and everyone around me was a ghost. I ended up going to the ER because of it (I actually thought my dead body was at the hospital and I wanted to go there to wake myself up). NEVER, EVER overdose on this medication. You will be sorry! But again, taken as prescribed, I am pleased with it. 
1691$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$1/14/2014 10:12:15 AM$Reviewer: Scared mom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver) $5$1$5$My daughter was on this medication for about 5 years and loved it. Only to end up in the emergency room with a seizure. PLEASE be aware of this Major issue!  It's real!!
1692$Condition: Depression$1/11/2014 10:49:51 AM$Reviewer: RxLisa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been taking Wellbutrin XL 300 mg for about 5 weeks now (started on 150 mg).  This has been much more effective than any other antidepressant I've taken.  In the past 20 years I've been on Prozac, Celexa, Zoloft (with and without Abilify) and also Deplin.  The first couple of weeks, I was a bit more irritable, but was ok with it, because I cared about things again and was engaging again in life.  I was mostly irritated at how I had let everything go because I just didn't care or have the energy to do anything.  In the last couple of weeks, I have developed neck pain, headaches, and intermittently blurry vision, which all are listed possible side effects.  It's working so well for my depression at this point that I'm willing to wait a couple of months to see if the side effects go away.  I'm not sure if I've lost weight, but I'm cooking more often and eating less.  With all the other meds I've tried, it was the other way around.  All medications have side effects, these, for me are tolerable to be able to enjoy my young children and actually enjoy life again.  Before Wellbutrin, I was just kind of dragging myself through life.  I've had depression pretty much my entire adult life and tried it with and without antidepressants.  So far, With Wellbutrin XL, I feel like myself again for the first time in a very long time.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $1$1$1$My daughter suffered a rare severe systemic allergic reaction (DRESS syndrome) after two weeks of being on this drug.  The reaction is often misdiagnosed as a virus
column3: as was in my daughter's case.  After two clinic visits and two trips to the ER
column4: she finally was diagnosed correctly
column5: but had to be hospitalized for a week.   She gained 30 lbs. of fluid in just a few days and was covered with a beet-red rash.  Her major organs were also affected.  She had to be treated with steroids
column6: which is another side-effect story.  Be your own advocate-  if you develop a rash while taking any prescription drug
column7: take it seriously!   Your life depends on it.  DRESS Syndrome is a living nightmare and too many doctors do not have the expertise to recognize it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$4$"Started out on the generic 150mg for 1 month and after no change in my depression

column4: paranoia and disorientation. I stopped taking it after I noticed that 3 days in a row I could not get out of bed. I felt like I was unable to control my movements. I could not use any of my motor skills and it felt like something heavy was holding me down. My doctor reported my symptoms to a neurologist who suggested that I may have been having seizures. Now I'm getting ready for an appointment to see the neurologist for an official diagnosis. I'm not sure if the name brand itself would have brought on the same results but I've been hearing too many negative feedback about the generic versions. Also not very pleased with my insurance for insisting that I take generic. The told me that if I want the name brand my copay would be about $300 for a 30 day supply (generic is only $15 for a 30 day supply). My doctor switched me to another newer brand which I am slowly adjusting to. So far the new meds allow me to sleep so I'm catching up on all that I missed while I was no the generic Welbutrin XL 300mg. I also gained 10 pounds while I was taking it so now I having to double up my workouts to lose it."

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have SAD(Seasonal Affective Disorder)and I have taken both the 300 & 150 mg Wellbutrin XL during the winter months for 8 years. It didn't help me to quit smoking

column1:
1895$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$6/20/2012 12:58:22 AM$Reviewer: intricate_eyes, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$4$I took 150mg of the generic bupropion HCL XL, once per day in the morning. First thing I noticed on the second day of taking it was that I was unusually short of breath, and my heart started being quickly randomly throughout the day. On the fifth day I woke up with a sore left arm, and the pain spread to the left side of my chest. Developed chest pressure and that continued on for the full 8 days that I took the medication and ended when I went off the medicine. My anxiety also seemed to have increased; I could never calm down and my body always felt heavy. However, the only somewhat positive thing I can mention is that I felt that this medicine kind of woke me up a bit; before I was pretty numb, but I started feeling again. The side effects were enough to make me go off of it within 8 days. I hope to try the name brand Wellbutrin to see if there is an improvement.

55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$This drug is doing a great job for me. I have been on it for 12 years. I originally took 150mg once a day; moved up to twice a day but switched to 300mg slow release so I wouldn't forget to take one of the doses. I tried so many different drugs over the past 20 years that I've lost count and the side affects were often horrific. Once my psychologist recommended Wellbutrin and my psychiatrist concurred I have never switched and it is the only anti-depressant I take. I also dropped 20 lbs of the 30 the other drugs had caused me to gain. It has helped with ADD
column3: SAD and the all encompassing symptoms of depression. There have been a few times during the years when I was unable to take it for several days in a row and you could tell but just one dose and I was back up feeling great. I'm sorry it doesn't work for everyone; it has so few uncomfortable side affects when compared to some of the newer drugs. But for those who have found relief I can tell you that after all these years I still have found relief. (My husband calls them my happy pills!)

It gave me horrible anxiety, palpatations and made me very edgy.  It also prevented my from falling asleep which is obviously a problem within itself.  I knew my pain was not from my job, posture, or poor ergonomics.  Once q went from 300mg to 150mg, most of my upper back pain was abolished.  When I quit cold turkey (you can with tis drug unlike SSRI's), my neck pain was abilished!!!   In the future when I take in a new patient, I will make sure to see if they are on buproprion. 1915$Condition: Depression$4/21/2012 4:30:52 PM$Reviewer: Olythia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Started these about 2 years ago after being  desperate because none of those that act on serotonin had worked for me. Best thing I ever did! I researched it on-line and found the ratio of people praising it to hating it was much more favourable than most other anti-depressants. Problem: I'm in the UK and it is only licensed for giving up smoking. So I have to order it from Europe or USA. I started by taking just a quarter of one 150mg tab and working up to the full dose by day 7. (different for everyone of course)

Doing it this way made it much easier on the side-effects which for me were itchy rash on my hand and foot and difficulty getting to sleep maybe a bit of nausea but I found if I  ate some food with them it helped -even though my research said it shouldn't affect. I have read that taking a quarter of a tablet and building up gradually to lessen side-effects doesn't work. It really does for me. Bupropion has made me feel completely ""normal"" I didn't feel like I was on medication at all
column2: until recently. After about a year and half I found I got occasional head pains. Not a headache as such. If I lay down on my front suddenly to watch television or something like that i would get a sharp pressure-like pain. I would keep still or slowly sit up and it would pass. after a few months I gradually started to get a slight hang-over feeling for a few hours most days. without any changes to my diet etc. I don't normally get headaches. My delivery was very delayed recently and I literally ran out. I was very worried what would happen with suddenly stopping (i could not get any from the doctor of course) Nothing happened so I stayed off them for two months. I can now very slightly feel anxiety on waking up that I used to get but only slightly so I decided to start again rather than wait until it gets bad. Today is the first day and I have a bit of that slight tightness in the head feeling. Anyone else had similar?"

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$1$"I do not recommend anyone take this medication Wellbutrin.  It caused my thoughts and behavior to be out of control.  I took it because my former MD said
column3: ""if you have chronic pain you also have depression"". I have never been depressed in my life yet placed on Prozac and changed to Wellbutrin. This medication made me end up in a mental health ward where doctors automatically place a person on anti-psych drugs. Anti-psych medications are scary and should never be given to patients automatically.  Wellbutrin made my thoughts and actions so crazy and doctors since have told me that this is a common side affect.  Scary thought! Due to the fact I was discharged on these crazy drugs to take at home I continued to have scary thoughts and odd behavior.  This has been a nightmare that I would not wish on my worse enemy. Ive been in and out of psych wards for four years due to drugs that are on the market and we are told we must take the medicine a doctor orders. The ER doctor sees my medical records of a former  mental illness and then send me back to be committed to a mental ward with several E.R.visits. It was a revolving door as I would be once again on medicine that alters ones thoughts and behavior. I am lucky as my doctor got me off of Wellbutrin and every time I have been forced into a mental health ward by an emergency room doctor
column4: my doctor weans me off of these terrible drugs and I am back to my old self.  I never had a history of mental illness until I started taking Wellbutrin and then being forced to take anti-psych medications will make your brain think things you wouldn't believe and behave in an out-of-control manner. column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$This medication has been a life saving treatment for me. I am currently on the maximum dose and I also take Lamictal(100mg)and Remeron(30 mg) to help with sleep. I hope my experience is helpful to someone out there who is suffering from this medical illness that can be difficult to treat.

column3: speaking to my psychiatrist who specializes in meds and heads the state board where I live
