2093$Condition: Depression$3/2/2011 3:43:33 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$"I just started taking this drug today
column2: and after reading the reviews I am concerned about the generic version I was given (Bupropion XL
column3: I think). According to one article
column4: it's the patented membrane that allows for extended release that seems to be the problem. Apparently some generics don't use the same XR method
column5: which can lead to a huge release of the active ingredient followed by little to no release. Wellbutrin has a membrane-like wall that allows a constant release
column6: but many generics use pills that just dissolve slowly. Other bodily functions can speed up or slow down the release (i.e.
column7: amount of food in stomach). Just thought this was interesting so I'm passing it along and will also ask my doctor about it.  http://www.prevention.com/health/health/healthy-l iving/find-out-how-to-use-generic-drugs-safely/ar ticle/ca929d93636d6110VgnVCM10000013281eac____

column1: 2102$Condition: Depression$2/15/2011 11:55:54 AM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$4$I'm a 17 year old female and suffer from axiety and depression. I've always been lucky in life and have had a great family and basically everything a child could ask for. Although
column2: I've had some tramatic experences in my childhood my parents where in the process of getting a divorce
column3: my father committed sucide when i was nine
column4: and i had to move 3 years later due to expensive living in New York. After i moved  to the south it was a major culture shock and sunk into a depression. I was always a bigger taller girl which affected my self esteem
column5: when i was 13 i weighted around 135 lbs and was 5'4. Over two years i gained 60 lbs and 3 cup sizes and am now 5'7
column6: thankfully i still had a shaply hourglass proportion. Finally when i was around 195 lbs. i was severly depressed and though ""how did this happen"" and ""why did i let myself go"" Everyone said you look fine your a beautiful girl. Thankfully not to toot my own horne
column7: but i am an attractive girl and look very mature for my age but that didn't matter i felt horrible. In 09 my doctor prescribed me Prozac 20 mg and i didn't like the though of being on medicine so i didn't take it reguarly  which is bad. It made my tired and it just did not work. My doctor was a prozac pusher lol. To make a long story short in October 2010 i wanted another advise and saw another doctor and he put me on WELLBUTRIN XL 150 Mg later uped me to 300mg. I though wow thats so much medicine compared to 20mg but he explained to me how it works differently and it has different mg and 150 isn't so much. 4 Months later now Feb 2011 i feel great and have lost 45 lbs in 3 months. The medicine isn't  a miracle drug or a weight loss drug. It just helps you feel like yourself
column8: actually i felt like i wasn't on meds. It helps motivate you to help yourself and get back on track and boosts energy. It severly decressed my hunger which was a super plus and motivated me to start working out. 4 months later with watching what i eat (even over the winter holidays) an"

2130$Condition: Depression$12/21/2010 2:40:38 PM$Reviewer: Mellow, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I have taken this med on and off for several years and can tell you that every person is very different and all of the other antidepressants we tried before this one gave me very sad thoughts. It does come with its side effects just like the rest and you will have to determine is it worth it in the end for you.  In my case the benefits out weigh the effects.  I have dry mouth and headaches and some tension at times, but most of the time I am mellow.  This is very important to me as I hate high strung people even my self when I can't control my racing thoughts and brain fog.  It is a great drug in my opinion.

2160$Condition: Depression$10/21/2010 8:29:38 PM$Reviewer: medwisegirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin has been great for me. All I wanted to do before taking this was sleep, and when I was up I was grouchy and irritated. I actually like getting up in the morning and enjoy my day. Everyone around me is much happier as well. I tried Cymbalta first and it didn't fit my specific needs, and in fact worsened my depression. There are different medicines for different types of depression. Wellbutrin works on the neurotransmitter dopamine. Dopamine is for motivation and acivating the reward center in the brain. I wouldn't discourage or encourage the use of this drug. It's your doctors job, depending on your depression symptoms, to match you with the best medicine for you. You need not listen to people that say not to try it, everyone is different. This medicine may or may not work for you. Treating depression is not an exact science, due to our lack of knowledge about the brain. Finding the right depression medicine will take trial and error, which can be very frustrating. Stick with it and you will find a medicine that works for you.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$"300mg dosage Wellbutrin XL

column1: The increased energy levels and motivation have really helped.  The initial euphoric/hyper feelings dissipate quickly but are still enjoyable for the first few days.  Bad thoughts and anxiety tend to pass much more quickly.  Bad moods and sadness are not nearly as ""low"" as they were before.  It makes it much more easy to combat problems instead of dwelling on them.  Improved sleep seems to be a result of the other effects.

column2: but this can be dealt with through proper diet.

column1: I also get more thirsty throughout the day.
Really reduces hunger pangs and overall appetite.  This has been very helpful for losing the weight put on while depressed.  It may not be good for those who are already lean."

13-18 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $5$5$5$"My 16 yr old son has been having problems in school for 2 yrs:Poor grades due to not doing homework
column3: also seemed have low self esteem and some mild depression (caused by above?). Hanging out with a ""bad"" crowd and some drug abuse. He's been in behavioral therapy for 2 years - I finally said
column4: ok
column5: nothing I am doing is working (therapy
column6: life coach skills
column7: summer school).  I was looking into wilderness camp for him too. But
column8: I did not want to put my son on drugs for poor grades.  I did not want him on amphetamine drugs - adamantly. He has been on Wellbutrin 150mg 1x/day for a month.  The change was almost immediate. He wanted to cut his hair shorter - which gave him a real boost when the kids (girls) noticed.  He has gone from a F/D/C student to an A student (it's only the 3rd week of school - so we'll see).  Teachers he has (again) have noticed the change and love it.  He is my son again.   He still has the dumb friends
column9: he still  is smoking uknowwhat I am sure - but it does not seem to be his all emcompassing thought.  He wants to go to the Jr Dance
column10: he is exercising and taking pride in his appearance
column11: he is talking to other kids too at school and noticing the difference in kids.   I am thankful I tried this medicine.  Even though the change is seems drastic - it feels ""normal"" to him
column12: not like he is BAM someone new - just an improved version of him.  My only thought is that after only being on this for one month his Doctor wanted to increase him from 150 to 300mg - I don't understand that - why kick it up (soo much after only a month) when it's fine?  So
column13: I said we'll try the 200mg - which is not timed release - lasts 8 hrs and if my son does not like it - we will go back to 150mg time release.  I guess the 300mg is timed release - but why drink Mountain Dew when a glass of water is really all you need? "

2241$Condition: Depression$6/15/2010 11:54:53 AM$Reviewer: abirata, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin had side effects at the beginning - the worst of which were insomnia and constipation. The insomnia abated after about 3 weeks of treatment and I take a fiber supplement to deal with the constipation. It also abates with time but never completely goes away. Another side effect at firt was a general ""hyper"" feeling but that also wore off after a few weeks. Unlike the SSRIs
column2: Wellbutrin does not make me feel ""drugged” - I feel emotions
column3: good and bad - but the difference I notice while taking the drug is that I tend not to brood or obsess over negative events or ideas
column4: it is easier to let them pass. I think it has also made me more able to open up to talking about my situation because I don’t think I have to reign in my “bad” emotions so tightly as I don’t fear them getting out of control. It is easier to work through them
column5: and talk about them. Wellbutrin by itself is a great help
column6: but by far the most effective treatment for me has been talk therapy. Depression runs in the family. I did not start seeking treatment until age 27 when it became overwhelming  and was affecting my work and relationships. The first course of treatment my physician prescribed were SSRIs (Paxil
column7: Prozac and Zoloft)
column8: but I could not tolerate the side effects nausea and drowsiness
column9: but the worst
column10: that although my depression was dampened
column11: so were all my emotions. These side effects never abated. I became even more distant from people I loved and could not function effectively at work because it was difficult to concentrate. I had great doubts about all of the anti-depressants after those experiences
column12: and am skeptical of drug claims and the pharmaceutical industry in general but have to admit that Wellbutrin has been very effective. I know that SSRIs are very effective for many  people - I just wanted to share that portion of my experience because I believed that because they did not work for me
column13: nothing would. I am glad to be proven wrong."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$3$I use to take Wellbutrin many years ago for depression. This was before they came out with the SR and XL. You had to take it using a starter kit that had a certain dosage for each day. Side effects were minimal for me except for severe upset stomach for the initial 2 to 3 weeks. It eventually subsided. My doctor said that side effect is rare. Well NOT 4 me. My doctor wrote me a prescription for XL 300 the other day to help me stop smoking. Im assuming the extended release formula replaces the need for the gradual starter kit. I sure hope so otherwise taking 300mg from the get go may be intolerable for my digestive system. It worked pretty well for my depression but what I remember most was the effect it had on reducing my smoking. Cigs tasted like sucking on molded burnt logs. I quit the medication because at that time I really wanted to enjoy my cigarettes again. Idiot I know. Not this time though. Those old molded burnt logs are going to be thrown out never to return. I suggest this medicine for smoking cessation over that new Cymbalta stuff. It has the same indications at about a tenth of the price. Cimbalta is just ripping people off. I really doubt it affects the brain much differently than does Wellbutrin. Especially when only taken for a short period. Wellbutrin is indicated for smoking cessation. If it was harmful to people who are not depressed I doubt that this purpose would be listed as one of the uses. If I could afford the Cimbalta I'd try it instead just to see how it compares for me versus Wellbutrin in altering the taste of cigarettes. My guess is Cymbalta does not work as well as Wellbutrin for this purpose. It was marketed differently probably due to the stigma some have for taking anti-depressants. It will interesting to see what the effects
column3: if any
column4: while taking when not depressed. It may have the effects of ecstacy...lol doubtful but it would make for quite an experience. Probably would not curb my craving for a cigarette. Will post results later

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin was a life saver for me. I was diagnosed with Major Depression 5 years ago and initially was prescribed Celexa. I felt a little better but still had no concentration or energy. My psychiatrist added Wellbutrin XL and it turned out to be the answer I needed. I would not have survived my depression without the addition of Wellbutrin to my celexa (300mg Wellbutrin and 40 mg Celexa). I know some people have shared negative side effects of this drug but you will not know unless you try it. It worked well for me but it is not for everyone. If you have depression please do not give up on finding the right medication for you. It just takes some time. I have been on meds and in individual therapy and it has been successful  in treating my depression. I am now to the point where I am titrating my Wellbutrin so that I can be med free and start a family. Thank you Wellbutrin for giving me my life back!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$The Brand Wellbutrin XL 300 mg works very well for me

My GP recognized that I was in trouble during a routine exam and sent me immediately to a therapist she highly recommended. This therapist works closely with a psychiatrist that I am now seeing.  She recognized that the problem was the generic form of Wellbutrin (I wasn't taking Lamictal at that time).  I read several reviews by patients experiencing the same problem
column5: with the same symptoms
column6: which I found on the internet. I owe my life to these doctors for recognizing the problem and switching me back to Brand Wellbutrin XL.  My insurance company still won't cover the Brand but insists on the generic even though my doctors have explained the problem and insisted that I take the Brand name drug. column5: crazy dehydration
column6: wierd flighty feeling
column7: nauseus
column8: lack of appetite.  I convinced myself to stick with it at uped my dose.  Experienced 4 days of the worst headaches of my life.  I had to quit completely b/c I couldn't function.  Waited a week and began 100 mg once a day again and this time no headaches
column9: I am sticking with my low dose since it seems to give me the extra lift I need.  I don't feel medicated or foggy.  The biggest thing to disappear was the feeling of being overwhelmed.  I feel like a weight was lifted off my shoulders.  As for side effects now...I have a tendency to get dehydrated more quickly when on the meds so I have to really drink alot of water.  If I don't hydrate the headaches follow.  Initially my appetite completely disappeared.  Now it's less but not significantly.  This med does seem to reduce cravings in general.  I am not a drinker but had a couple drinks (despite my better judgement) on NY's Eve.  The next day or 2 I felt like the meds weren't working.....felt lethargic
column10: just down.  Definately not worth the drinks of Champagne so I'll abstain 100% for now.  I am at a much lower dosage then is prescribed for most people but it works for me.   Main con i that I do notice that I can become agitated quicker.  I am usually the most laid back person
column11: almost too laid back.  So for me it's not a big deal but I wouldn't recommend this med to anyone who has a tendency to anger easily or experiences anxiety."

column3: my best advice to anyone with depression and/or bi-polar disorder is to try any meds that are offered or are available.  It took a while to find the medications that worked for me.  Don't be worried about taking more than one drug either
column4: if you need to.  I have been taking Wellbutrin XL for 3 1/2 YEARS.  I am taking 450 mg and have been for most of that time period.  I have had excellent results on this med
column5: and have had no side effects at all
column6: ever
column7: nor have I had any significant weight gain.  This medicine has worked wonderful for ME.  I have bi-polar disorder; therefore I also take Lamictal 400 mg
column8: and Seroquel 100 mg.  This is the ""cocktail"" of meds that have worked for me.  Medicine affects everyone differently.  Don't think that just because one person had serious side effects that you will also.  This medicine may be just what you need.  Sometimes you have to trust the doctor more than the reviewers.  The doctors know what the side effects may be.  They are in no way trying to hurt you!  They are trying to help you the only way they know how!  Good luck and God bless you!  There is hope
column9: just don't give up!"

column1: 2420$Condition: Depression$10/2/2009 9:33:06 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I had suffered from depression for years before I started taking Wellbutrin.  It has made a major positive difference in my life in the way I handle things; I am able to think much more clearly and rationally.  For the first few years I combined the medication with therapy.  I was taking 225 mg when I started and have had to increase it once to 300 mg/ day.  I currently take the Wellbutrin 300 XL.  Word of caution on the generic version of Wellbutrin 300 XL - I tried it when it was approved and found after a few months that I was becoming depressed again.  The generic did not work for me; the tablet may have the same amount of medication but the packing (what makes up the rest of the pill)is completely different than the brand name.  For me it seemed like instead of medication being steadily administered to my system throughout the day it hit all at once
column2: thus the return of the depression.  I was hoping to be able to save some money with the generic but it is worth it to me to take the brand name.

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have suffered from depression most of my life.  In my early 20’s I started see a psychiatrist.  I received talk therapy as well as antidepressants’ throughout my life.  I have been off & on Prozac for the past 20 years.  For nearly two years
column3: I have had trouble with sleeping too much (anywhere from 12 to 20 hours a night).  When I saw my regular doctor
column4: she suggested increasing my Prozac to 40mg & said I should expect to stay on it for the rest of my life (I am 63).  With no improvement she added Effexor (75mg).  It didn’t seem to improve the sleeping or depression.  Besides the excessive sleeping
column5: I also felt like crying all the time; found no joy in life; had no energy; & no motivation to do anything (other than what was absolutely necessary ).  I went to a psychiatrist  and he decreased the Effexor  (37.5mg).  With still no improvement
column6: he stopped the Effexor and started me on Wellbutrin (300mg).  Within about three weeks I felt like a “normal” person.  I would wake before the alarm would ring
column7: had more energy and felt not so hopeless. I hadn’t felt like this in a long time.  The change lasted about two months.   After he wrote the next prescription for Budeprion XL (300mg)
column8: which he said was cheaper.  I started to feel like I was going back to my old pattern of sleeping too much (not as bad as before but still too much) and not as much energy as with Wellbutrin..  I am sad to say I did not experience any weight loss with either the Wellbutrin or the generic.  While taking the generic
column9: I had some adverse effects which include: dry mouth; tremors of the hands; increase in resting heart rate (85+ per minute); trouble keeping my balance and some hair loss.  When I see the psychiatrist in a month
column10: I plan on having write a prescription for Wellbutrin
column11: not the generic.  It is worth the extra money.

column1: 2555$Condition: Bipolar Depression$5/2/2009 9:39:22 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been on Wellbutrin xl 450mg/day for a little over two years now and for me it is what works. My mood doesn't flip at the slightest negative event and one annoying thing no longer ruins an entire day for me. I can think clearly and positively without losing my ability to be upset when there is a reason to be. (nothing like showing up to a funeral grinning and cracking jokes because you can't feel sad.) I don't have issues with getting up in the morning (well not ones that I didn't have long before the bipolar set in. I am not a morning person.) and I don't have the issues of manic episodes where I can't sleep until I have to be medicated into unconsciousness. I no longer constantly sit at my desk with the lights off holding a box cutter and staring at it for hours or go off on screaming rants about things that are trivial. I feel in control of myself and my actions as opposed to the constant feeling of being out of control; an observer in my own self destruction. This is what it does for me. Considering that we are all complex creatures of finely balanced chemicals it may not for you but that doesn't mean there isn't something that can help you regain control of your life. Take time with your physician to figure out what is right for you. And be picky it's your life if something isn't working go back to your doctor and try something else don't torture yourself and end up even worse.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on wellbutrin for 15 years-I came off of it for a short time but the anxiety caused me to return to it again. Like most depression sufferers I have tried many drugs over the years but this one has the least side effects and works great. I occasionally get dry mouth so you do need to stay hydrated.  I was a smoker and a drinker and have kicked both habits as the drug really does reduce cravings for any pleasure. Unfortunately that does include sex as well-it does decrease your libido but that can be overcome if you work at it! It does not decrease the pleasure level but the desire to get started just isn't there. I did have a period of time where I was not eating as it does also take away your cravings for food. My hubby loves to eat so he makes me eat too
column3: so I have not had anorexia since I met him but I did with my first husband. So I would say that an understanding mate goes a long way toward helping to make this drug a success. I take 150 sr upon waking and before bed. My insurer is also pushing the generic but that did not work for me. I understand there are some generics that are better than others and if the cost is a factor you could try those first. I am convinced that wellbutin treats alcoholism because it runs in my family and I was a problem drinker until I took wellbutrin. I can have a drink now and not want another-but that may just be me. It is sure worth a try if you drink too much-I don't know why it is not more widely used for treating alcoholism because it works. You do have to take wellbutrin for 60 to 90 days to get the full effect of the drug.During that time you do have dry mouth but that subsides after a while and was not a significant problem for me. I am 62 years old so I don't know how much longer I will take it but the doctors seem to think that it is a lifelong drug. It has made a drastic change in my life and I recomend it highly!!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$5$2$Have taken this over 10 yrs
column3: very effective for keeping me in sane stable mood w/o inappropriate crying.  I can cope .  I tried stopping several times

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$5$Was prescribed the generic Bupropion HCL for mild depression and anxiety.  The first few days on 150 mg were a little scary.  I had a headache the entire time.  This only lasted about 3 days.  On the fifth day started 300 mg.  Loved the energy boost and eveniness of my mood. I also immediately quit smoking...have tried quitting many times before with no success. I started getting bad cramps and realized I was horribly constipated.  Tried upping my fiber and fluid intakes but nothing helped.  I had to stop taking it because of this...BUMMER.  I really liked this med and wish I could continue but I can't take laxative everyday to conteract the constipation!!!!!!!  Some decrease in sexual desire did occur.  My doc prescribed me Effexor XR and I filled the ordered but I do not think I will try this one because of the horrible things I have been reading about it.  I will be asking her about Cymbalta because the reviews seem much more positive.  I wish the makers of Wellbutrin/Bupripion could fix the constipation issue because it worked great for me!

2640$Condition: Depression$2/24/2009 8:24:38 PM$Reviewer: ABMN, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$In Dec 2007 I was prescribed Wellbutrin 150mg, after the initial few weeks it just didn't seem to be working. My doctor bumped me up the the XL. It started working almost immediately. It felt as if the veil and earmuffs had been removed and colors and sounds became real again. I was extremely happy with the 50 lbs I lost. Sex drive came back with a vengeance. No listed side effects. It is now Feb 2009 and it doesn't seem to be working anymore; back to being irritable, short tempered and just sad. Going to Dr in 2 days to see if something else will work. One side effect that I can't find anyone else having is it messed with my period, even on birth control. My period would come whenever it wanted regardless of what week of pills I was on. Once I switched to taking the BCP at night and Wellbutrin XL in the a.m. it seemed to get MUCH better. Now that the wellbutrin isn't working as great, my cycle is completely whacked. Usually one week w/o it, then get it for a few days, then another week w/o, etc. Doctors say it has nothing to do with each other but I have been on the same BCP for almost 6 years and it didn't happen until I started taking the Wellbutrin XL.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$3$"     -Generic Brand vs. Name Brand Wellbutrin XL-

column1: I've been on Wellbutrin for (about) a year and MUST comment on the effects of the generic brand
column2: Bupropion (Sp?).
I spent a while on the generic version and failed to progress out of my depressive state. For a few weeks I felt like I was mildly feeling a change
column3: but eventually it felt like I had plateaued
column4: and shortly after
column5: I returned to spiraling downward.

column1: There were other medications added and subtracted to Wellbutrin in order to determine the right combination of drugs to aid my depression/anxiety/ADD. I AM POSITIVE that my only improvement was the result of other medications (Lamictal- mood stabilizer).
It has been documented that the generic version of this drug does NOT produce the same progressive results as the name brand. I can confidently say
column2: that my experience w/ Bupropion was not a good one
column3: in fact

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$3$Have been taking 100mg for 7 days then upped to 200 mg.  Felt a little nausea

column1: 3103$Condition: Stop Smoking$10/28/2007 10:00:07 AM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months$5$5$5$After years of smoking and probably hundreds of attempts to quit

column3: I tried to quit smoking once again. For the first time
column4: I was able to go a day
column5: then 2
column6: then 4
column7: then a week
column8: then a month without a cigarette!  I am so grateful for this drug.  I have not smoked in 7 1/2 years thanks to Wellbutrin.  I never thought I'd be able to say that!  It's wonderful.

column1: 3130$Condition: Stop Smoking$10/15/2007 12:52:43 PM$Reviewer: Cadiac/Open Heart RN
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$I took it for anxiety and to quit smoking.  After smoking for 18 years...I quit.  Yes
column3: it did cause some nausea at first...however you must eat when taking this medication.  Take with meals.  Also
column4: don't give up.  It also has a side effect which decreases hunger.  I lost weight after quitting smoking...about 10 lbs.  I was scared after quitting smoking I would gain.  I didn't I lost.  This medication is a wonder drug.  It is rough in the begining as your body adjust.  It's not fun but give it time the side effects will go away and it is effective overall.  I really support the use of this drug.  I am an RN and also think if this drug does not help with smoking cessation try Chantix.  I am an Open Heart Nurse and we have had great success with our patients on Chantix.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$2$4$" I am ""somewhat"" dissatisfied with this medication. I recently was prescribed wellbutrin due to anxiety and addiction to cigarettes. I took it for 3 weeks and yes quit smoking but had more anxiety than ever and more depression. I had many fits of out of control crying and anger. My boyfriend brought the medication I was on to my attention because he knew that i was a little on the emotional side but not possessed. I even had a week long outbreak of hives. Although I am only 90% sure this was the medications fault. I was so distracted at all the other stuff I was going through I did not crave cigarettes and as far as drinking was involved I got sick after two drinks so I am taking a vacation from alcohol as well. I still have hives on and off so hopefully in another 24 hours the medication should be completely out of my system and hopefully hive free. I will finally be able to breath peacefully and with out a cigarette in my hand."
